channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024081189
item.description:
Report X-2024081189

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was found by the morning sort as an unprocessed hazmat originating from another station. While attempting to process it they realized it was missing the 1.4 diamond placard. There was no damage to the contents or package it just doesn't have the diamond label. Since it is not compliant do to the lack of the hazard class diamond and we are not the origin station we are not able to process this package.

item.title: Report X-2024081029
item.description:
Report X-2024081029

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA with visible leakage and a strong odor. Upon further inspection it is revealed that one of the caps on a bottle had come loose causing it to spill. We believe this to be undeclared as the SDS and the percentage given on the package marks it as limited quantity but there were no ground limited quantity marks visible on the package and nothing to indicate it in FTrack.

item.title: Report X-2024080855
item.description:
Report X-2024080855

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-20
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BURLINGTON NORTHERN RAILROAD HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank car PNWX 706447 released fuel oil onto the tank car body and an 8x8 inch area on the ground. No waterways or storm drains impacted. Contractor found a defective manway lid gasket. Gasket was replaced and manway lid secured. Car was cleaned and released into transportation.
